News.headline: Match Report: Gillingham FC 1 - 2 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.page_title: Match Report: Gillingham FC 1 - 2 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.URL_keywords: Match Report: Gillingham FC 1 - 2 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.short_description: The Daggers travelled to Priestfield Stadium this afternoon for a behind closed doors friendly against League one side Gillingham
News.description:
After a relatively slow start to the game the Gills almost took the lead when left back Bradley Garmston fed Rory Donnelly who forced a save from Daggers keeper Mark Cousins.
 
The visitors responded a minute later with winger Jordan Maguire-Drew firing a shot from 30-yards which just went over the bar.
 
The deadlock was broken on 32 minutes when the Daggers took the lead. Young trialist Lamarl Reynold whipped the ball into the Gills area and, after a deflection off a defender, Paul Benson found the back of the net.
 
Two minutes after the break, The Gills came close to equalising with midfielders Lee Martin and Mark Byrne interchanging passes and the latter forcing a good save out of Cousins who parried the ball round the post
 
The visitors didn’t heed the warning and The Gills found the equaliser on 50 minutes. Lee Martin skipped past Luke Howell and Josh Staunton then slotted the ball past Cousins to level the score.  
 
However, The Daggers retook the lead again five minutes later when Maguire-Drew drove into the opposition box and found the bottom right corner.
 
It proved to be the final goal of the afternoon and a good workout for both teams. The Daggers will be back to Vanarama National league action this Saturday when they host Chester.
 
Daggers: Cousins; Ling, Doe, Staunton; Howells, Howell, Heard (Shepherd, 78 mins); Maguire-Drew, Bloomfield (White, 57 mins), Reynolds (Donnellan, 57 mins), Benson
 
Gills: Holy; O'Mara, Trailist, Dickenson, Garmston, Osadebe, Byrne, Knott, Martin, Donnelly, Parker
